meanings.definition: A person who mindlessly repeats or imitates the words or actions of others.
meanings.sent1: The group of parroters in the classroom echoed everything the teacher said.
meanings.sent2: The parroters at the party kept mimicking each other's dance moves.
meanings.sent3: The parroters in the office unintentionally turned the workplace into a symphony of repeated phrases.
meanings.sent4: The parroters in the meeting room made it feel like a playback of someone else's words.
meanings.sent5: The image of the parroters repeating each other's sentences stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Plural form of parroter, referring to multiple individuals who mimic or copy others.
meanings.sent1: The park was filled with parroters imitating the sounds of different animals.
meanings.sent2: The group of parroters in the talent show copied each other's performances.
meanings.sent3: The parroters at the zoo made visitors chuckle with their imitations of the staff.
meanings.sent4: The forest was alive with the chirping of the parroters mimicking each other.
meanings.sent5: The parade of parroters marching in unison was a sight to behold.
